term.longtitle: IUPAC Gold Book - point of zero charge (p.z.c.)
term.title: point of zero charge

item.text: A surface charge is at its point of zero charge when the surface charge density is zero. It is a value of the negative logarithm of the activity in the bulk of the charge-determining ions.

sources.item: PAC, 1991, 63, 895. 'Nomenclature, symbols, definitions and measurements for electrified interfaces in aqueous dispersions of solids (Recommendations 1991)' on page 902 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199163060895)
